126 Maple St. Ste. F
Big Rapids, MI, 49307-1878
Re: License #: CB540201289
Dear Amy Eddinger:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
May 1, 2023. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The agency is not in need of technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The agency did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
corrective action plan was submitted in response to licensing renewal inspection
report dated 5/17/2022 and was approved on 5/18/2022. During the review the
agency had one violation. There were no repeat violations in the current
inspection. During this period under review the agency has experienced an
increase in requests to serve youth outside of the program's age range.
2

Chief Administrator Assessment
The assessment reported no barriers during the period under review. The previous
inspection noted one violation. The Chief Administrator stated the agency
implemented an employee checklist to ensure compliance and states it has been
effective.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were identified.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were conducted with two staff face-to-face at the agency. Staff
acknowledged the agency has had some challenging cases. However, they stated
coworkers and supervision were available to assist when needed. Staff reported
no areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of independent living services. All files were stored securely.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
_________5/3/2023___________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
